content: Hello Mister Heine, thanks for inviting me to see the apartment. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Max Müller

content: Hello there! Thank you for showing interest in my apartment. As the landlord, I do want to make sure that we agree on a rental price that is fair for both of us. What do you think would be an appropriate amount for a 25 square meter apartment?
name: Heinrich Heine

content:
Yes, I have a question: How much would the rent be per month, and is it negotiable?

I am also interested in knowing the utilities included in the rent.
name: Max Müller

content: Certainly! The rent for this apartment is negotiable, but I am looking to maximize my gains. Based on the size and location of the apartment, I was thinking a monthly rent of around €800 would be reasonable. This includes basic utilities such as electricity and water, but additional charges for heating and internet may apply. Would you be able to meet this rental price?
name: Heinrich Heine

content:
I am a student and I will be living alone, so I would prefer if the rent could be lower. Can you give me a counter-offer?

Also, could you tell me more about the utilities included in the rent?
name: Max Müller

content: I understand your situation as a student, and I am open to negotiating the rental price. Based on your needs, I am willing to consider a lower rental price of around €600 per month, which would still include basic utilities such as electricity and water. As for additional charges, heating and internet would be handled separately and would be the responsibility of the tenant. Would this rental price be more reasonable for you?
name: Heinrich Heine

content:
Yes, that would be much more reasonable for me.

Regarding the utilities, could you please clarify what is included in the rent? For example, is electricity and water included in the rent or is there an extra charge for these?

Also, do I have to pay for my own internet connection, or is that also included in the rent?

Lastly, is there a minimum lease term that I need to commit to?
name: Max Müller

content:
Certainly! The rent includes basic utilities such as electricity and water, but there may be additional charges for heating and internet. Heating will depend on the season and the type of heating system in the apartment. Internet connection is also separate and would need to be arranged by the tenant.

As for the lease term, I am looking for a minimum of one year commitment. This period would provide me with stability and ensure that I am able to maximize my gains from the rental property. Is this something you would be able to commit to?
name: Heinrich Heine

content:
Yes, I can commit to a one year lease.

Regarding the heating, is it included in the rent or do I have to pay for it separately?

Also, is there a possibility of extending the lease beyond one year?

Lastly, is there a move-in fee or any additional charges that I need to be aware of?

Thank you for your time and consideration!
name: Max Müller

content:
Certainly! Heating is not included in the rent and would need to be arranged separately. However, I can provide you with information on local heating providers and help you set up a contract.

Regarding extending the lease beyond one year, it is possible, but it would require a mutual agreement between you and I. I would need to review the market and see if there is a demand for the apartment beyond the initial lease term.

As for a move-in fee or additional charges, there may be a security deposit required, which would be returned to you at the end of the lease term, provided you meet the terms of the agreement. I would be happy to discuss this with you further and provide you with a detailed breakdown of any additional charges. Thank you for considering my apartment, and I look forward to hearing from you soon!
name: Heinrich Heine
